column2: Why don’t we go to the movies tomorrow?
I’d love to. How about 3 o’clock?
What’s your favorite subject?
My favorite subject is English.
What are you interested in?
I’m interested in basketball.
What is your opinion about social media?
It’s good for relationships.
I wonder if she likes the scarf.
I think she will.
What is Kimbap?
It is Korea’s most popular on-the-go meal.
Do you know how to use this kiosk?
Yes, I do.
I feel tired these days.
I think you should sleep early.
Can you open the door?
No problem.
Can you stand on one leg?
Yes, I can.
Which do you prefer, summer or winter?
I prefer winter.
Why do you want to join the dance club?
Because I want to practice dancing.
Are you going to have a birthday party this Saturday?
Yes, I am looking forward to it.
What are you going to do this weekend?
I am going to play soccer with my friends.
How can I get to the museum?
Go straight two blocks and turn right.
Would you like some fried chicken?
Yes, please. Wow, it’s really good!
Do you have any plans for this weekend?
I will see a movie. I’m looking forward to it.
How are you doing?
<I’m great|Not bad|Not good>.
Do you mind if I drink this water?
Not at all. Sure, go ahead.
Have you ever been to Busan?
No, I haven’t.
May I take pictures in the museum?
You must not take pictures here.
What surprised you at the trip?
I was surprised by nature.
What should I bring on a sports day?
Don’t forget to bring water.
Can I ask you to call me back?
Okay. I’ll call you back later.
What should I do?
Why don’t you write a letter for her?
What do you think about my backpack?
I think its color is beautiful.
Can I ride a bike to school?
No, you can’t.
What’s going on?
I’m looking forward to going camping.
It will rain soon.
Make sure you take an umbrella.
How do you like this backpack?
I like it. I like its design.
What’s the matter?
I am worried about my presentation.
What did you do last weekend?
I went shopping with my friends.
I am going to enter a singing contest.
I will keep my fingers crossed for you.
I think math is really fun.
Well, I don’t think so. It is so hard.
In my opinion, Mr. Yoon is the best teacher in our school.
<I agree with you|I don’t agree with you>.
Hi, I’m <John|Park|Minho>. I’m in first grade.
<Nice to meet yo|Glad to meet you>.
What are you going to talk about?
I’d like to tell you about our school.
Can you recommend something from the menu?
I recommend that you try tomato pasta.
Is it going to rain?
Yes. I’m sure it’s going to rain soon.
Can I help you with cleaning?
I appreciate your help.
Can you tell me how to cook ramyeon?
First, boil the water.
How do you like the shirt?
I’m not really happy with it. It’s too small for me.
What time and where should we meet?
Let’s meet in front of the movie theater at 10 o’clock.
What does she look like?
She is tall and has short hair.
You have to follow our school rules.
Okay, I will.
You look upset. What happened?
I’m upset with my friend. She broke her promise.
What should I do to become a chef?
It is important to develop cooking skills.
Thanks for your understanding.
You’re welcome.
How are you feeling?
I feel excited.
How’s the weather in New York?
It is cold and snowy.
Who is she?
This is my sister.
You should be nice to your friend.
Okay, I will|I’m sorry. I see it now.
I heard that it might rain.
Then, I should bring my umbrella tomorrow.
How do I use this vending machine?
First, put the money in. Second, choose the drink. Third, push the button.
Where can I find the library?
You can find it on the first floor.
What will you do for the earth?
I will reduce trash.
What kind of music do you listen to?
I listen to K-pop.
Where is my phone?
There is a phone on the desk.
Congratulations on your birthday.
Thanks a lot.
What is she doing?
She is walking the dog.
May I bring my dog on the bus?
<Yes, you may|No, you may not>.
You like playing soccer, don’t you?
<Yes, I do|No, I don’t>.
I should have worn my mittens.
I should have worn my jacket today.
How much is this headphone?
It’s 200,000 won.
I want to sing well, but it’s so hard.
Don’t give up. You can do it. Keep trying.
How much is this shirt?
It’s 10 dollars.
What did the news say?
The news said the city hall will be closed for 2 weeks.
Which is bigger, Korea or China?
China is bigger than Korea.
How often do you go to the library?
I go to the library three times a week.
Do you find it helpful to read English newspapers?
Yes, it helps me learn English.
How long does it take to go to school?
It takes about ten minutes.
What are you planning to do on vacation?
I’m planning to study math.
What do you usually do in your free time?
I usually play games.
I’m afraid that’s not right.
I didn’t know that.
What do you want for lunch?
I want a hamburger.
What do you want me to do?
Please put the name on them.
What would you like to order?
I’d like to order two chocolate waffles.
What’s your plan for this summer?
I’m thinking of reading some books.
Where is Gyeongbokgung?
It is in Seoul.
What does the gesture mean?
It means ‘hello’ or ‘goodbye’.
What do you want to be in the future?
I want to be a doctor.
This is Minsu. Is Amy there?
<This is her speaking|She’s not here>.
Can I try this jacket on?
<Sure. Go ahead|I’m afraid you can’t>.
What [sport] do you like [the most]?
It’s English|I like English the most.
Thank you for the help.
<Don’t mention it|No worries|It’s nothing>.
Do you want to go to the concert with me?
I’d love to, but I can’t.
I’d like to exchange this shirt.
I want to exchange it for a blue one.
How was the movie?
It was very fun.
Are there any other drinks?
<Yes. We have lemonade, too|Sorry, these are the only two we have>.
Have you heard about a new restaurant?
No, I haven’t.
Is it possible to use paper cups in the cafe?
You’re not supposed to use paper cups.
Who is the man?
He is my English teacher, Mr. Kim.
What is he like?
He is outgoing.
When were you born?
I was born in 2010.
What is it for?
It is for brushing teeth.
I wish I could see Earth from the moon with my own eyes.
Me, too. It will be so cool!
What are you good at?
I am good at drawing pictures.
What’s wrong?
I have a cold.
Can I help you?
I am looking for a pair of running shoes.
What would you do if you were me?
If I were you, I would be nicer to my family.
